title: Bank of Canada Governor Says Higher Rates Needed to Douse Inflation, Remove Excess Demand
sub_head: Tiff Macklem says economy can handle higher rates, adds slowdown in housing would be ‘healthy’ after unsustainable price growth
body:
OTTAWA—Bank of Canada Gov. Tiff Macklem said the economy needs interest-rate increases to douse historically high inflation and remove excess demand from the economy, especially in the housing sector where sales and price growth were unsustainably elevated during the pandemic.
Mr. Macklem reiterated the need for higher rates, and the central bank’s resolve to move quickly and forcefully if necessary, at a press conference in Ottawa on Thursday following the release of the central bank’s annual assessment of risks to the domestic financial system. A good chunk of that report, the Financial System Review, focused on the vulnerabilities posed by more households that are financially stretched after the purchase of a home, and elevated house prices, which the central bank said, for the first time, reached “exuberant” territory in most Canadian cities during in the first quarter.
